intro: Hymenothrix glandulosa var. nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's glandular hymenothrix, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. The plant has glandular structures on its leaves and stems, which may play a role in its ecological interactions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
